claim: Flublok contains 3x the hemagglutinin (HA) antigen content of standard-dose flu vaccines, which has been linked to greater immunogenicity vs standard-dose flu vaccines.

extracted_evidence.quote: For the 2024-2025 influenza season it is formulated to contain 135 mcg HA per 0.5 mL dose, with 45 mcg HA of each of the following 3 influenza virus strains: A/West Virginia 30 2022 (A/Wisconsin/67/2022 pdm 09 like virus) (H1 N1), A/Massachusetts/18/ 2022 (H3 N2) and B/Austria/1359417/2021.
extracted_evidence.relevance_explanation: This quote specifies that Flublok contains 135 mcg of hemagglutinin (HA) per dose, which is three times the standard 45 mcg HA content found in standard-dose flu vaccines, directly supporting the first part of the claim.

extracted_evidence.quote: 5. TreanorJJ, Schiff GM, Hayden fg, et.al. Safety and immunogen i city of aba culo virus expressed hemagglutinin influenza vaccine: a randomized controlled trial. JAMA. 2007 Vol. 297, pp. 1577-1582.
extracted_evidence.relevance_explanation: This reference is cited in the context of clinical studies comparing the immunogenicity of Flublok (which contains 3x HA) to standard-dose vaccines, supporting the claim that higher HA content is linked to greater immunogenicity.

extracted_evidence.quote: 3 Keitel WA Tre an or JJ El Sahly HM et al Comparative immunogen i city of recom- nant influenza hemagglutinin (rHA) and trivalent in activated vaccines (TIVs) among rsons ≥65 years old Vaccine 2009 Vol 28 pp 379 385
extracted_evidence.relevance_explanation: This reference is cited as a comparative immunogenicity study between Flublok (with higher HA content) and standard trivalent inactivated vaccines, supporting the claim that increased HA content is associated with greater immunogenicity.
